intro: Isolepis coarctata, commonly known as narrowleaf spike-rush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces spike-like clusters of small, brown flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Isolepis coarctata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
